item.title: 特朗普用大锤敲打拜登的芯片法案
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是我们改版后的每日时事通讯，由彭博社全球记者提供有关科技商业的报道和分析。今天，麦肯齐-霍金斯（Mackenzie Hawkins）对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）宣布取消在美国建厂的芯片制造优惠政策做出回应。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our revamped daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. item.title: 米莱今年需要结束的所有大型外汇和资本管制措施
item.description: 哈维尔-米莱就任总统一年多以来，严格的外汇管制仍然是外国投资者寻求将资金投入阿根廷资产的最大障碍。【原文：More than a year after Javier Milei became president, strict exchange controls remain the biggest hurdle for foreign investors looking to allocate funds toward Argentine assets.】

item.title: 世界优先事项发生变化，非洲领导人关注粮食主权
item.description: 一个联合国机构的负责人说，俄罗斯与乌克兰的战争以及全球向国家优先事项的转变促使非洲领导人关注粮食自给自足问题。【原文：Russia’s war with Ukraine and the worldwide shift toward national priorities has pushed African leaders to focus on food self-sufficiency, the head of a United Nations’ body said.】

item.title: 微软与 OpenAI 130 亿美元的合作获英国监管机构批准
item.description: 微软公司对 OpenAI 公司 130 亿美元的投资获得了英国反垄断监管机构的批准，结束了这一合作数月来的不确定性。【原文：Microsoft Corp.’s $13-billion investment into OpenAI Inc. was cleared by the UK’s antitrust watchdog, ending months of uncertainty over the tie-up.】

item.title: 菲利普斯 66 在董事会斗争中反击激进分子埃利奥特
item.description: 菲利普斯 66 在周三致股东的一封信中对激进投资者埃利奥特投资管理公司（Elliott Investment Management）进行了反击。【原文：Phillips 66 is fighting back against activist investor Elliott Investment Management in a letter to shareholders Wednesday.】

item.title: 从大豆到钢铁，中国发出不会退缩的信号
item.description:

US President Donald Trump wasn’t named on the first day of Beijing’s annual parliament, but his presence was felt.

】

item.title: 关税和 Con Ed 涨价加剧了纽约市的经济负担危机
item.description:
安大略省威胁要对供应给该州的电力进行报复性征税，而该市的主要公用事业公司正在寻求批准提高电费。【原文：

Ontario is threatening retaliatory levies on electricity supplied to the state — just as the city’s main utility is seeking approval for higher bills.

】

item.title: 美国抵押贷款利率接近三个月低点，刺激了需求
item.description: 美国抵押贷款利率上周降至近三个月的低点，激发了住房再融资和购房贷款活动，这对陷入困境的房地产市场来说是一个值得欢迎的迹象。【原文：US mortgage rates declined last week to an almost three-month low, sparking lending activity for home refinancing and purchases in a welcome sign for the struggling housing market.】

item.title: 卢特尼克称赞特朗普 "公平 "为加拿大和墨西哥斡旋减免关税
item.description: 美国商务部长霍华德-卢特尼克（Howard Lutnick）表示，墨西哥和加拿大的关税可能很快就会有所松动。甚至可能就在今天。【原文：US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick is signaling there might be some relief from tariffs for Mexico and Canada sooner rather than later. Maybe even today.】

item.title: 德国 "不惜一切代价 "推动欧洲市场发展
item.description: 德国的超常支出计划正在撼动该地区的市场，推动欧洲股市在今年超越美国股市，并使欧元从与美元平价的边缘重新崛起。【原文：Germany’s extraordinary spending plans are shaking up the region’s markets, powering European equities past US peers this year and reviving the euro from the brink of parity with the dollar.】

item.title: Reddit 和 Digg 联合创始人联手利用人工智能重振 Digg
item.description: Reddit Inc.联合创始人亚历克西斯-奥哈尼安（Alexis Ohanian）与前商业竞争对手凯文-罗斯（Kevin Rose）合作，重新启动了曾被誉为 "互联网主页 "的平台 Digg Inc.。【原文：Reddit Inc. co-founder Alexis Ohanian has teamed up with former business rival Kevin Rose to relaunch Digg Inc., a platform once dubbed “the homepage of the internet.”】

item.title: 安杜兰对冲基金业绩下滑 37% 后抹去去年收益
item.description: 2025 年头两个月，石油交易商皮埃尔-安杜兰（Pierre Andurand）抹去了去年的所有收益，继续在动荡的商品市场上坐过山车。【原文：Oil trader Pierre Andurand erased all his gains from last year in the first two months of 2025, continuing his rollercoaster ride in volatile commodities markets.】

item.title: 美国主导地位受到挑战，欧洲引领新兴市场反弹
item.description: 新兴市场货币和股票反弹，原因是市场押注更高的关税将导致美国经济放缓并转移投资流，而德国的支出计划也提振了欧洲资产。【原文：Emerging-market currencies and stocks rallied on bets higher tariffs will slow the US economy and divert investment flows, just as Germany’s spending plans gave a boost to European assets.】

item.title: 默茨撕毁默克尔的遗产，释放德国的消费能力
item.description: 候任总理弗里德里希-梅尔兹（Friedrich Merz）计划让德国摆脱前领导人安格拉-默克尔（Angela Merkel）十多年来对其国家的财政束缚，此举将彻底改变公共财政，并为欧洲最强大的经济体增强该地区的国防实力铺平道路。【原文：Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz plans to free Germany from the fiscal straitjacket that former leader Angela Merkel had locked her country into for more than a decade, a move that will revolutionize public finances and pave the way for Europe’s most powerful economy to bulk up the region’s defense.】

item.title: 特朗普向国会发表讲话后，交易员看到 S&P 500 指数剧烈波动
item.description: 本周美股一路狂飙，期权交易员预计，随着交易员评估最新的关税进展，并为周五的月度就业报告做好准备，美股还将继续狂飙。【原文：US stocks have been on a wild ride this week, and options traders expect more of that to come as traders assess the latest tariff developments and brace for Friday’s monthly jobs report.】

item.title: 特朗普发出征收 25% 进口关税的信号，美国铜价大涨
item.description: 由于美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）建议对进口金属征收 25% 的关税，铜价在纽约飙升超过 5%，进一步超过其他全球基准。【原文：Copper prices surged by more than 5% in New York — leaping further above other global benchmarks — as US President Donald Trump suggested imports of the metal could be subject to a 25% tariff.】

item.title: 平价之谈熄火，交易员加码押注欧元再涨 10
item.description: 交易商们正在增加赌注，赌欧元在未来几个月内将上涨 10%以上，最高升至 1.20 美元，这一水平上一次出现是在 2021 年。【原文：Traders are adding to wagers the euro will rise more than 10% in the coming months to as high as $1.20, a level last seen in 2021.】

item.title: 加纳通胀率连续第二个月放缓，降息成为关注焦点
item.description: 加纳通胀率连续第二个月放缓，为央行自 9 月份以来首次降息提供了空间。【原文：Ghana’s inflation slowed for the second straight month, providing room for the central bank to cut interest rates for the first time since September.】

item.title: 经济不确定性加剧，多伦多房屋销售下滑 29
item.description: 多伦多 2 月份的房屋销售量降至过去一年中的最低水平，原因是购房者在经济承受能力方面面临挑战，而且经济不确定性也给购房者造成了压力。【原文：Toronto home sales in February fell to the lowest level in the past year as affordability challenges and economic uncertainty weigh on buyers.】

item.title: 英伟达图表观察者准备迎接更多痛苦，跌势买家逍遥法外
item.description: 过去一个月来，Nvidia 公司股价遭受重创，市场技术人员一直在追踪一个关键的动量指标，以寻找未来更多麻烦的迹象。【原文：The selloff that’s hammered Nvidia Corp. shares over the past month has market technicians tracking a key momentum indicator for signs of more trouble ahead.】

item.title: 关税给经济增长带来风险，美元创三个月新低
item.description: 由于担心美国关税对经济产生负面影响，美元跌至三个月低点，其中兑欧元的跌幅尤为明显。【原文：The dollar fell to a three-month low on concerns about the negative impact of US tariffs on the economy, with losses particularly stark against the euro.】

item.title: Blackstone 即将以 4 亿美元收购印度 South City Mall
item.description: 据知情人士透露，印度最大的业主之一 Blackstone Inc.【原文：Blackstone Inc., one of the largest landlords in India, is nearing a deal to acquire South City Mall in Kolkata for as much as $400 million, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 曾是 Trafigura 首席执行官竞争者的 Hallouche 即将离开交易商
item.description: Trafigura 集团下游石油部门负责人、曾被誉为公司未来领导者的高管哈迪-哈卢什（Hadi Hallouche）即将离开公司。【原文：Hadi Hallouche, head of Trafigura Group’s downstream oil division and an executive who was once touted as the firm’s future leader, is leaving the company.】

item.title: 欧盟寻求将有争议的天然气存储目标延长两年
item.description: 尽管成员国普遍担心天然气储存规则助长了市场投机并抬高了价格，但欧盟仍将提议延长天然气储存目标。【原文：The European Union will propose an extension of gas-storage targets despite widespread concern among member states that the rules are contributing to market speculation and inflating prices.】

item.title: 英国调查揭露私募市场不良估值行为
item.description: 英国最高金融监管机构警告说，在快速发展的私募市场领域，估值可能存在无法缓解的利益冲突、记录保存不善和平滑波动等问题。【原文：Valuations in the rapidly-growing private markets arena can suffer from unmitigated conflicts of interest, poor record-keeping and smoothing of volatility, the UK’s top financial regulator warned.】
